bug.author: paulomorone
bug.summary: FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
bug.description:
First of all... I'd like to thanks a lot the developers of this package, it helps a lot. I'm trying to save the results into a HTML file using the to_file function and it works fine if i don't specify a folder path, but when i specify where i want to save my html file it giver this error. Without path (works fine) profile15.to_file(outputfile= '2015.html', ) With path (don't work) f_path = '/content/gdrive/My Drive/MBA Analytics e Big Data/TCC 2.0/' profile15.to_file(outputfile= f_path'2015.html') <denchmark-h:h2>Error:</denchmark-h>
FileNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) in () 2 profile15.to_file(outputfile= 'MATRICULA_2015.html', ) 3 profile16.to_file(outputfile= 'MATRICULA_2016.html') ----> 4 profile17.to_file(outputfile= f_path +'MATRICULA_2017.html') 5 profile18.to_file(outputfile= f_path +'MATRICULA_2018.html') 1 frames /usr/lib/python3.6/codecs.py in open(filename, mode, encoding, errors, buffering) 895 # Force opening of the file in binary mode 896 mode = mode + 'b' --> 897 file = builtins.open(filename, mode, buffering) 898 if encoding is None: 899 return file FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/content/gdrive/My Drive/MBA Analytics e Big Data/TCC 2.0/MATRICULA_2017.html'

comments.comment:
Could you provide the minimal information to reproduce this error?
the minimal code you are using to generate the report which environment you are using (jupyter notebook, console or IDE) and packages (pip freeze > packages.txt) a sample or description of the dataset (df.head(), df.info())
